intro: Cheilanthes × kurdica, commonly known as the Kurdish rock fern, is a hybrid species native to the mountainous regions of Turkey and the Middle East. It is a member of the Polypodiaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage and drought-tolerant nature. The plant typically grows on rocky substrates and is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its fronds are usually leathery and have a dark green color, with sporangia arranged in clusters on the undersides of the leaves. Cheilanthes × kurdica is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in rock gardens and as a houseplant.
